definition:
A *normed plane* is a pair $(\mathbb{R}^2, ||\cdot||)$, where the
function $x \to ||x||$ is a norm.

If we define a distance function $d(x,y) = ||x-y||$ then the metric
space $(\mathbb{R}^2, d)$ is called a *Minkowski plane* or a *Minkowski
geometry*.

The classical examples of Minkowski and normed planes are the $p$-norm
$||x||_p = (|x_1|^p + |x_2|^p)^{1/p}$ where $1 \leq p < \infty$ and the
maximum or supremum norm $||x||_{\infty} = \max\{|x_1| , |x_2|\}$.
